snippet: The states — Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Indiana, Kentucky, Massachusetts, Minnesota, Oklahoma, New Jersey and Tennessee — will have to set new performance targets.
abstract: President Obama frees 10 states from some of the crucial provisions of the No Child Left Behind law, including a deadline for bringing all students to proficiency in reading and math by 2014; the states--Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Indiana, Kentucky, Massachusetts, Minnesota, Oklahoma, New Jersey and Tennessee--are the first to receive waivers from the Bush-era law, in exchange for embracing the Obama administration’s educational agenda and its focus on accountability and teacher effectiveness.
lead_paragraph: The states — Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Indiana, Kentucky, Massachusetts, Minnesota, Oklahoma, New Jersey and Tennessee — will have to set new performance targets.

headline.seo: 10 States Given Waivers From ‘No Child Left Behind’ Law
headline.main: 10 States Are Given Waivers From Education Law
headline.print_headline: 10 States Are Given Waivers From Education Law
